Academic Advising Informatics
----------------------------------------

The Academic Advising Informatics is available for all students of the Professional Profile Informatics and the Master's Program Data Engineering and Analytics and covers topics including (but not limited to):
Adacemic Student Advising:
- Examination regulations
- Individual study plans due to leave of absence or Master’s Informatics part-time program
- Support for disabled or chronically ill students
- Repeating exams and catching up after falling behind the regular program schedule
Don't forget to check out our Tips for Sucessful Studies!

----------------------------------------

Academic Advising Informatics > Moodle Course of the Acadamic Advisors Informatics

How to contact the Academic Advisors
Academic Advising Informatics > How to contact the Academic Advisors
Please send all emails to the academic advisors from one of your TUM-email adresses!
You can always reach us by email (study-advising(at)in.tum.de). If you would like to attend a consultation (in person, virtually, or by phone), you can do so during our office hours without making an appointment. Contact information is in the right sidebar (or mobile at the bottom of the page). Every consultation is confidential!
Please be aware that our academic advisors have no access to your official study records. Therefore, we ask you to bring a print-out of your grade report when visiting us or to send us one in advance via email. You should always know by heart how many ECTS you have already obtainedan in which subject-related semester (Fachsemester) you are in.
Please do not hesitate to ask for advice - the sooner you come by, the better and faster we can advise you and help you find a solution!
